BasicDescription.Title: Today
BasicDescription.Synopsis: With Edward Stourton and James Naughtie. Includes Sports Desk at 6.25am, 7.25am and 8.25am; Weather at 6.55am and 7.55am; Thought For The Day at 7.45am. Yesterday In Parliament at 6.45am.

BasicDescription.Title: The Choice
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Michael Buerk talks to people who have faced life-changing choices and dilemmas which have irrevocably altered their lives.

BasicDescription.Title: Cutting A Dash
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The Endangered Apostrophe: Is a misplaced apostrophe a catastrophe? Has the proper use of the comma reached a full stop? Lynne Truss explores the changing fashions of punctuation.

BasicDescription.Title: Book Of The Week
BasicDescription.Synopsis: My Life As Me: Barry Humphries casts off his Dame Edna Everage mantle to read from his hilarious autobiography in his own voice. He recalls his early days in Melbourne. .

BasicDescription.Title: Woman's Hour
BasicDescription.Synopsis: With Jenni Murray. Includes at 10.45am the drama Live Alone And Like It, by Marjorie Hillis. How does the newly-single girl build a social life?

With Jenni Murray. Includes at 10.45am the drama Live Alone And Like It by Marjorie Hillis, dramatised by Mary Cutler.
With Frank turning up at every opportune and inopportune moment, Marjorie's diary is full. But how does the newly-single girl build a social life? Judith and Sylvia will know.
When it was published in 1935, Live Alone And Like It rapidly became a best-seller both here and in America. With chapter headings like Solitary Refinement; Your Leisure - If Any; Pleasures Of A Single Bed; Will You Or Won't You? and A Lady And Her Liquor, it covered every aspect of the single life. So get out your best bedjacket, and lie back and enjoy Mary Cutler's hilarious and imaginative account.
Marjorie ...... Serena Evans Judith ...... Celia Imrie Sylvia ...... Haydn Gwynne Frank ...... Robert Daws Miss Stark ...... Alison Carney

BasicDescription.Title: The Thin Green Line
BasicDescription.Synopsis: A new three part series. Winifred Robinson follows a rural enforcement agency as it investigates a conflict between keepers and poachers.

In this new 3 part series, Winifred Robinson eavesdrops on the work of rural enforcement agencies, beginning with an investigation of that most traditional of countryside conflicts - keeper versus poacher.

BasicDescription.Title: Aynuch And Ayli
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Josie Lawrence presents a hilarious journey through the comic heritage of the West Midlands. From comedians of yesteryear like Music Hall duo Aynuck and Ayli to modern comics like Frank Skinner.

Josie Lawrence presents a hilarious journey through the comic heritage of the West Midlands. From comedians of yesteryear like the original Music Hall duo Aynuck and Ayli and Dolly Allan to modern day comics like Frank Skinner and Lenny Henry.
The programme explores the factory floor roots of the Black Country comic. We look at how the industrial heritage of the area and the factory based humour of furnace and casting house developed into an identifiable comic muse which is still traceable in the West Midlands club circuit.
Even today, the Black Country comics make jokes about the social aspirations of Solihull residents (or "gold-tappers" as they are called because of their taste in bathroom fittings). The alleged lack of craftsmanship of people from Birmingham (a hammer is called a "brummies screwdriver") and foreman jokes are still high on the hit list for working men's club comics in Dudley and Tipton.

BasicDescription.Title: News
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest national and international news headlines from BBC Radio 4.

BasicDescription.Title: You And Yours
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Consumer news and discussion with John Waite and Peter White. Includes Call You And Yours at 12.30pm - call 08700 100 444 [national rate] with your comments on today's programme.

BasicDescription.Title: The World At One
BasicDescription.Synopsis: National and international news from BBC Radio 4. With reports from our correspondents worldwide. Presented by Nick Clarke.

BasicDescription.Title: Soul Music
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Somewhere: The hit song from West Side Story has come to have special significance for many. Mary Wilson of the Supremes explains how she found it a fitting tribute to Martin Luther King.

Somewhere
The hit song from West Side Story has come to have special significance for many. We hear from Mary Wilson of the Supremes who found it a fitting tribute to Martin Luther King and a mother who sings it at the end of a long day with her autistic son.

BasicDescription.Title: The Archers
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Debbie meets with her solicitor.

BasicDescription.Title: Afternoon Play
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Maigret: A Man's Head. By Georges Simenon. Dramatised by David Cregan. The detective returns to radio in the first of four stylish new dramas. Julian Barnes reads the voice of Simenon.

Maigret: A Man's Head
By Georges Simenon. Dramatised by David Cregan.
Geoges Simenon's finest creation, Inspector Maigret of the Police Judiciare in Paris is one of the greatest heroes of detective fiction. Played by Nicholas Le Prevost, the character returns to radio in the first of four stylish new dramas.
Reading the voice of Simenon is the acclaimed British novelist Julian Barnes.
As Simenon's centenary approaches in February 2003, this case from the 1930s evokes the Paris of Hemingway, and a touch of Dostoyevsky, in a city of jazz.
Cast includes:
Maigret ...... Nicholas Le Prevost Simenon ...... Julian Barnes Lucas ...... Ron Cook Kirby ...... Paul Birchard Mrs Kirby ...... Beth Chalmers Com�liau and Bob ...... Philip Fox Radek ...... Ifan Meredith Janvier ...... Tom George Edna and Mother ...... Jane Whittenshaw Heurtin and Dufour ...... Ben Crowe
Music by Lucinda Mason Brown
Directed by Ned Chaillet

BasicDescription.Title: Making History
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Sue Cook gets to the bottom of historical mysteries, local legends, family curiosities and architectural oddities. Write to Making History, PO Box 3096, Brighton BN1 1PL.

BasicDescription.Title: Love And Loss
BasicDescription.Synopsis: A Season Of Madness: By Hanan-al-Shaykh. A Lebanese woman goes to extraordinary lengths to escape from a loveless marriage. From a series of five stories about the bitterness of love.

BasicDescription.Title: Blood Chronicles
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The Science Of Blood: Graeme Garden explores the history of blood science, from the age of enlightenment to the amazing discoveries of Landsteiner in the 20th century.

BasicDescription.Title: More Or Less
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The lively magazine series devoted to the powerful, sometimes beautiful, often abused but ever ubiquitous world of numbers. Presented by Andrew Dilnot.

BasicDescription.Title: A Good Read
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Rosie Boycott presents the book review programme with guests Observer columnist and reviewer Sue Arnold and soprano Catherine Bott, widely known for her work in early vocal music.

BasicDescription.Title: PM
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Full coverage and analysis of the day's news, plus the sports headlines. Presented by Clare English and Eddie Mair.

BasicDescription.Title: Six O'Clock News
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest national and international news from BBC Radio 4.

BasicDescription.Title: Radio Active
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Out Of Your Depth: Station Boss Sir Norman Tonsil generously pays for Martin Brown to become an all round entertainer for as long as it keeps him away from the station.

Out Of Your Depth:
Martin Brown gets his one and only chance to do something useful with his life, as Station Boss Sir Norman Tonsil generously pays for him to become an all round entertainer for as long as it keeps him away from the station.
Cast includes:
Sir Norman Tonsil ...... Angus Deayton Anna Daptor ...... Helen Atkinson-Wood Martin Brown ...... Michael Fenton-Stevens Mike Flex ...... Geoffrey Perkins Nigel Pry ...... Philip Pope
Song by Philip Pope and Steve Brown and performed by the Hee Bee Gee Bees.
Written by Angus Deayton and Geoffrey Perkins with additional material by Jon Canter, Moray Hunter, John Docherty and Richard Curtis.

BasicDescription.Title: The Archers
BasicDescription.Synopsis: David's mission is successful.

BasicDescription.Title: Front Row
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Mark Lawson with the latest on the arts.

BasicDescription.Title: Live Alone And Like It
BasicDescription.Synopsis: By Marjorie Hillis, dramatised by Mary Cutler. How does a newly-single girl build a social life? Published in 1935, the novel is a progenitor of Bridget Jones' Diary.

Live Alone And Like It
By Marjorie Hillis. Dramatised by Mary Cutler.
With Frank turning up at every opportune and inopportune moment, Marjorie's diary is full. But how does the newly-single girl build a social life? Judith and Sylvia will know.
When it was published in 1935, Live Alone And Like It rapidly became a best-seller both here and in America. With chapter headings like Solitary Refinement; Your Leisure - If Any; Pleasures Of A Single Bed; Will You Or Won't You? and A Lady And Her Liquor, it covered every aspect of the single life. So get out your best bedjacket, and lie back and enjoy Mary Cutler's hilarious and imaginative account.

BasicDescription.Title: File On 4
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Julian O'Halloran reports on major issues, changing attitudes and important events at home and abroad.

BasicDescription.Title: In Touch
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Peter White with news and information of particular interest to blind and partially-sighted people. Followed by News.

BasicDescription.Title: Case Notes
BasicDescription.Synopsis: A guide to your back and how to look after it. Why are we getting so much back pain, what can we do to protect our backs, and how can the health professionals help?

BasicDescription.Title: The World Tonight
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Analysis of the day's national and international stories, including interviews with politicians and public figures. With Robin Lustig.

BasicDescription.Title: Book At Bedtime
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Tiger In The Smoke: A Body In Pump Place. Anton Lesser reads Margery Allingham's evocative story of menace and mayhem in the fog-bound streets of post-war London.

BasicDescription.Title: Out Of The Blue
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Shadow Melodies: By Patricia Hannah. On his unexpected odyssey, the embalmed body of Lenin has ended up on the island of T�st where he enjoys the company of Henrik Ibsen.

Shadow Melodies
By Patricia Hannah
On his unexpected odyssey, the embalmed body of Lenin has ended up on the island of T�st. He enjoys the company of Henrik Ibsen while Angela tries to work out what to do with him.

BasicDescription.Title: Today In Parliament
